author: Theo Francis
title: Why Mattel and Hasbro Workers a World Apart on Pay
text:
To see why global-supply chains have supplanted domestic manufacturing, look no further than Transformers action figures and Barbie dollsâ€”and employee-pay figures publicly traded companies are disclosing for the first time.
Hasbro Inc., which sells Transformers, as well as Star Wars and My Little Pony figures and many other toys and games, paid a typical worker about $74,000 last year.
